oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Blank Confederate service oath
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Oaths
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Blank Confederate service oath form. The signing soldier would affirm to bear true faith and yield obedience to the Confederate States of America and observe the orders of the President of the Confederate States and of the officers appointed, according to the rules and articles of war. This form was printed in 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- War Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Requiring an oath of service was typical of both the confederate and federal armies.
